Uses of Class
com.badlogic.gdx.ai.steer.SteeringBehavior

  • Packages that use SteeringBehavior 
    Package Description
    com.badlogic.gdx.ai.steer  
    com.badlogic.gdx.ai.steer.behaviors  

    • Uses of SteeringBehavior in com.badlogic.gdx.ai.steer

      Subclasses of SteeringBehavior in com.badlogic.gdx.ai.steer 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  GroupBehavior<T extends com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector<T>>
      GroupBehavior is the base class for the steering behaviors that take into consideration the agents in the game world that are within the immediate area of the owner.
      Methods in com.badlogic.gdx.ai.steer that return SteeringBehavior 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      SteeringBehavior<T> SteeringBehavior.setEnabled(boolean enabled)
      Sets this steering behavior on/off.
      SteeringBehavior<T> SteeringBehavior.setLimiter(Limiter limiter)
      Sets the limiter of this steering behavior.
      SteeringBehavior<T> SteeringBehavior.setOwner(Steerable<T> owner)
      Sets the owner of this steering behavior.

    • Uses of SteeringBehavior in com.badlogic.gdx.ai.steer.behaviors

      Subclasses of SteeringBehavior in com.badlogic.gdx.ai.steer.behaviors 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Alignment<T extends com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector<T>>
      Alignment is a group behavior producing a linear acceleration that attempts to keep the owner aligned with the agents in its immediate area defined by the given Proximity.
      class  Arrive<T extends com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector<T>>
      Arrive behavior moves the agent towards a target position.
      class  BlendedSteering<T extends com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector<T>>
      This combination behavior simply sums up all the behaviors, applies their weights, and truncates the result before returning.
      class  Cohesion<T extends com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector<T>>
      Cohesion is a group behavior producing a linear acceleration that attempts to move the agent towards the center of mass of the agents in its immediate area defined by the given Proximity.
      class  CollisionAvoidance<T extends com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector<T>>
      CollisionAvoidance behavior steers the owner to avoid obstacles lying in its path.
      class  Evade<T extends com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector<T>>
      Evade behavior is almost the same as Pursue except that the agent flees from the estimated future position of the pursuer.
      class  Face<T extends com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector<T>>
      Face behavior makes the owner look at its target.
      class  Flee<T extends com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector<T>>
      Flee behavior does the opposite of Seek.
      class  FollowFlowField<T extends com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector<T>>
      The FollowFlowField behavior produces a linear acceleration that tries to align the motion of the owner with the local tangent of a flow field.
      class  FollowPath<T extends com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector<T>,P extends Path.PathParam>
      FollowPath behavior produces a linear acceleration that moves the agent along the given path.
      class  Hide<T extends com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector<T>>
      This behavior attempts to position a owner so that an obstacle is always between itself and the agent (the hunter) it's trying to hide from.
      class  Interpose<T extends com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector<T>>
      Interpose behavior produces a steering force that moves the owner to a point along the imaginary line connecting two other agents.
      class  Jump<T extends com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector<T>>
      First the Jump behavior calculates the linear velocity required to achieve the jump.
      class  LookWhereYouAreGoing<T extends com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector<T>>
      The entire steering framework assumes that the direction a character is facing does not have to be its direction of motion.
      class  MatchVelocity<T extends com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector<T>>
      This steering behavior produces a linear acceleration trying to match target's velocity.
      class  PrioritySteering<T extends com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector<T>>
      The PrioritySteering behavior iterates through the behaviors and returns the first non zero steering.
      class  Pursue<T extends com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector<T>>
      Pursue behavior produces a force that steers the agent towards the evader (the target).
      class  RaycastObstacleAvoidance<T extends com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector<T>>
      With the RaycastObstacleAvoidance the moving agent (the owner) casts one or more rays out in the direction of its motion.
      class  ReachOrientation<T extends com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector<T>>
      ReachOrientation tries to align the owner to the target.
      class  Seek<T extends com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector<T>>
      Seek behavior moves the owner towards the target position.
      class  Separation<T extends com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector<T>>
      Separation is a group behavior producing a steering acceleration repelling from the other neighbors which are the agents in the immediate area defined by the given Proximity.
      class  Wander<T extends com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector<T>>
      Wander behavior is designed to produce a steering acceleration that will give the impression of a random walk through the agent's environment.
      Fields in com.badlogic.gdx.ai.steer.behaviors declared as SteeringBehavior 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected SteeringBehavior<T> BlendedSteering.BehaviorAndWeight.behavior 
      Fields in com.badlogic.gdx.ai.steer.behaviors with type parameters of type SteeringBehavior 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<SteeringBehavior<T>> PrioritySteering.behaviors
      The list of steering behaviors in priority order.

      Methods in com.badlogic.gdx.ai.steer.behaviors with parameters of type SteeringBehavior 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      PrioritySteering<T> PrioritySteering.add(SteeringBehavior<T> behavior)
      Adds the specified behavior to the priority list.
      BlendedSteering<T> BlendedSteering.add(SteeringBehavior<T> behavior, float weight)
      Adds a steering behavior and its weight to the list.
      void BlendedSteering.BehaviorAndWeight.setBehavior(SteeringBehavior<T> behavior) 
      Constructors in com.badlogic.gdx.ai.steer.behaviors with parameters of type SteeringBehavior
